item.title: Resident Evil Requiem Leak Reveals New Gameplay Details
item.description:
A credible insider has claimed some exciting new gameplay details for Resident Evil Requiem , including vehicular traversal and Last of Us Part 2-style combat. With Capcom set to officially reveal Resident Evil Requiem gameplay in the coming days, the highly-anticipated ninth mainline entry in the survival horror series could feature some impressive upgrades on that front.

Following 2021's Resident Evil Village , there's been a lot of hype surrounding the next chapter of the franchise. After multiple purported internal delays over the years, Resident Evil Requiem was finally unveiled at Summer Game Fest 2025 a few months ago. The reveal trailer confirmed that Resident Evil Requiem will take the series back to an annihilated Raccoon City, essentially picking up after the events of Resident Evil 3 . Moreover, Grace Ashcroft was confirmed as Resident Evil Requiem 's protagonist, and leaks suggest that Leon Kennedy will star in the game alongside her.

Resident Evil Requiem Reportedly Allows Players to Traverse Open Levels with Vehicles

Though Resident Evil Requiem 's setting and graphical fidelity have impressed fans, many wonder what its gameplay could look like. Some preliminary tidbits, like the ability to switch between first-person and third-person in Resident Evil Requiem , were officially confirmed, but larger details remain under wraps. Reliable Capcom insider Dusk Golem has stepped up to the plate and shared some new alleged Resident Evil Requiem gameplay details in a recent Twitter thread. A notable bit of info the insider revealed is that Raccoon City will feature open levels , among other areas, and there will be a vehicle to traverse them too.

Capcom is apparently working to achieve good performance in Resident Evil Requiem 's open levels, and 60fps should hopefully be on the cards too. Aside from that, Resident Evil Requiem 's combat looks to be getting a big shake-up. Leon Kennedy's segments in Resident Evil Requiem will reportedly draw heavily from Naughty Dog's The Last of Us Part 2 , with enhanced stealth mechanics, fluid melee interactions, and an emphasis on tense, methodical encounters. Meanwhile, gameplay sections featuring Grace will focus on environmental interactivity, allowing players to creatively dispatch enemies using objects in their surroundings while balancing light and darkness as part of the core survival loop.

Should Dusk Golem's information hold true, Resident Evil Requiem 's gameplay may well be among the best and most innovative in the series. Vehicular traversal would be quite an interesting addition, because while previous Resident Evil games have allowed players to drive a car or take control of boats, aircraft, etc., Requiem could integrate this mechanic into its gameplay instead of reserving it for certain sequences. The rather brutal combat style of The Last of Us Part 2 would likely adapt well for Leon too, given he's likely going to be older and more jaded in Resident Evil Requiem .

item.title: Helldivers 2 is About to Check a Massive Item Off Halo Fansâ€™ Wish Lists
item.description:
Helldivers 2 took the world by storm when it first dropped onto PC and PS5 in February 2024. Within just a few weeks, Helldivers 2 managed to bring in over 450,000 players on Steam, and it managed to maintain much of its impressive player-count for a few months, with the game's steady stream of free content and player-friendly battle passes keeping fans hooked.

But just five months after launch, Helldivers 2 lost 90% of its PC player-base, dropping from an all-time peak count of 458,709 to around 40,000 per day by the end of June 2024. Flash forward a little over a year and Helldivers 2 currently has a 24-hour peak player-count of 31,845, a far cry from its launch month figures but still a sizable following. And that loyal group might be receiving a new influx of members soon. Helldivers 2 is finally heading to Xbox Series X/S on August 26, and it might be bringing something Halo fans won't want to miss.

Helldivers 2 Might Finally Give Halo Fans Their ODST Follow-Up

Halo 3: ODST Left a Lasting Impression

Released in 2009, Halo 3: ODST saw developer Bungie transfer its beloved Sci-Fi shooter formula to a new group of protagonists. Rather than put players in the heavy Spartan boots of the Master Chief once again, Halo 3: ODST had fans suiting up as various members of Alpha-Nine, an elite squad of Orbital Drop Shock Troopers led by Gunnery Sergeant Edward Buck (voiced by Firefly and The Rookie star Nathan Fillion).

Aside from criticisms levied towards the game's shorter runtime, Halo 3: ODST received very positive reviews upon its original 2009 release. Both fans and critics alike heavily praised ODST 's tonal shift, its core cast of characters, and its distinct setting and atmosphere. Over the last 16 years, Halo 3: ODST has only grown in popularity, with it standing out alongside Halo Reach for its refreshing change of pace and protagonists.

Though ODSTs have popped up in games like Halo Wars , and Nathan Fillion's Edward Buck returned in Halo 5: Guardians , fans still long to see the ODSTs get another chance to stand in the series' spotlight, either in their own dedicated spinoff or as a prominent part of a new mainline Halo entry.

Though Buck is the only member of Alpha-Nine to reappear in Halo 's mainline entries, the squad's story does continue in the Halo: New Blood and Bad Blood novels, both written by Matt Forbeck.

Helldivers 2 Might Be Giving Halo's ODSTs Another Chance in the Spotlight

Though it isn't the fully-blown return Halo fans were hoping for, the series' ODSTs might finally be getting another chance to shine. Helldivers 2 's recent "Bring the Boom" trailer ended with a shot of an abandoned city street, with rain pouring from above and covering the camera lens, and a lonely saxophone playing a tune that will be all too familiar to anyone who's ever walked Halo 3: ODST 's New Mobasa isolating streets at night.

At the time of writing, developer Arrowhead hasn't officially confirmed a Helldivers 2 x Halo crossover, but it seems incredibly likely given the obvious nature of the tease and the trailer's direct connection to Helldivers 2 's imminent launch on Xbox.

If Helldivers 2 's Halo crossover is anything like its December 2024 Killzone collaboration, then fans can expect to see a handful of cosmetics inspired by the fellow Sci-Fi gaming franchise come to the live-service shooter. And given the very specific nature of Helldivers 2 's Halo tease, it seems very likely that these cosmetics will be based on the franchise's ODSTs.

The first wave of Helldivers 2 's Killzone crossover was heavily criticized due to its high price tag. So much so that the second wave was given to fans for free. Helldivers 2 's Halo crossover is likely to land somewhere in the middle price-wise.

Much like the Helldivers 2 x Killzone crossover, this upcoming Halo collab could even add a few new weapons to the game. Halo 3: ODST 's silenced SMG and silenced pistol would be safe choices for Helldivers 2 's arsenal, but Arrowhead could always throw in some surprise additions like the Spartan Laser, Energy Sword, or Fuel Rod Cannon. Regardless of what content Helldivers 2 chooses to carry over, it'll be a genuine pleasure to see Halo 3: ODST receive more love.

item.title: Roblox Hypershot: Best Crosshair Settings Guide
item.description:
Some shooters are casual experiences, while Hypershot offers players a challenge. In this Roblox game, you will find several classic modes, such as Deathmatch or Free for All. Regardless of the mode you choose, you can only win if you have skill. Luckily, the developers have added a customization feature to make life easier for players. This guide will detail the best crosshair settings in Hypershot .

At first, you may not pay attention to these settings, but the more you encounter skilled players, the more you will notice the shortcomings of the default crosshair.

Hypershot Crosshair Settings Explained

Since Hypershot is an FPS experience, your skills alone determine victory or defeat. Of course, you can experiment with different loadouts to find the right weapon for your playstyle, but you may not even realize how the crosshair affects your performance. The default crosshair can sometimes blend in with the environment and also interfere with your aim due to animations. So, if you want to take top places in rounds, you need to create a custom crosshair in Hypershot .

Go to the settings and select the crosshair tab in Hypershot . The developers give players up to 15 slots for different custom crosshair options, so you can quickly change them if you wish to make them for specific modes or loadouts. That said, a lot of the options may not be clear to players. Below, you can find all the crosshair settings in Hypershot and their descriptions.

Settings

Description

Color R

The amount of red color in your crosshairs.

Color G

The amount of green color in your crosshairs.

Color B

The amount of blue color in your crosshairs.

Show Lines

Enable or disable crosshair lines.

Length

Determines the length of crosshair lines.

Width

Determines the width of crosshair lines.

Spacing

Determines the distance between the crosshair lines in the centre.

Opacity

Adjusts the transparency of crosshair lines.

Outline Size

Change the outline size of crosshair lines.

Outline Opacity

Change the transparency of the crosshair outlines.

Centre Dot

Enable or disable the central dot in the crosshair.

Dot Size

Change the size of the central dot.

Fade on Reload

Reduces the visibility of the crosshair while reloading.

Dynamic

Enable or disable crosshair position lock.

Show Hitmarkers

Enable or disable crosshair animations.

Best Hypershot Crosshair Settings

First of all, it is worth noting that each player should create a custom crosshair depending on their preferences and playstyle in Hypershot . However, if you want to save time, it's recommended to use the crosshair described below.

Settings

Best Value

Color R

Color G

255

Color B

Show Lines

Enabled

Length

8

Width

Spacing

2

Opacity

1

Outline Size

Outline Opacity

Centre Dot

Enabled

Dot Size

2

Fade on Reload

Disabled

Dynamic

Disabled

Show Hitmarkers

Disabled

This has been tested in different modes and with various weapons and has gotten very good results that could easily crown these the best crosshair settings in Hypershot .

item.title: GTA 6 Isn't the Only Game Rockstar Is Working On
item.description:
Given that it has been twelve long years since the release of Grand Theft Auto 5 , many fans assumed that Rockstar Games would now solely be working on Grand Theft Auto 6 and nothing else, but it looks like that's not actually the case. Take-Two Interactive's CEO, Strauss Zelnick, recently discussed Rockstar Games and Grand Theft Auto 6 in a new interview and revealed that the studio has "a lot of other things going on" outside of the highly anticipated title.

Unlike other popular franchises, such as Call of Duty or WWE 2K , new entries in the Grand Theft Auto series are few and far between. As one of the most popular video games of all time, Rockstar has become well-known for taking its time to perfect each new installment, and Grand Theft Auto 6 is no different. After an epic reveal trailer in December 2023, Rockstar announced that it was targeting a Fall 2025 release for the next GTA game. However, the studio shared disappointing news earlier this year when it delayed the release of Grand Theft Auto 6 to May 26, 2026. Rockstar said it needed additional time to ensure that the title lives up to the expectations previously set by the studio.

Take-Two Says Rockstar Is Working on More Than Just GTA 6

It's highly likely that a large portion of Rockstar Games is currently involved in the development of Grand Theft Auto 6 , but it looks like the studio may also have other projects already being worked on at the same time. In a new interview with CNBC (via TheGamer and Rockstar Mag), Take-Two Interactive CEO Strauss Zelnick said that Rockstar has "a lot of other things going on" when asked how much of the studio is actually working on Grand Theft Auto 6 . The CEO didn't elaborate on what these "other things" were, but did state that the next Grand Theft Auto game is Rockstar's "primary focus."

Zelnick's comments could allude to a magnitude of different projects, given that Rockstar has some pretty iconic IPs under its belt. Fans have been begging the studio for either a Bully remake or sequel for years now, but there has been very little in the way of leaks or rumors that suggest Rockstar intends to do anything with the nearly twenty-year-old title. What is more likely is that Rockstar is working on a current-gen version of Red Dead Redemption 2 . While the 2018 prequel can be played on PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S via backward compatibility, rumors suggest Rockstar could be working on a native version with some big improvements.

Whatever Rockstar is working on outside of Grand Theft Auto 6 , it's going to be quite some time before fans get any official look at it. Many are currently concerned that the title could slip even further into 2026 if Rockstar feels it needs more polishing time. However, Zelnick has also made it clear that he's confident in Grand Theft Auto 6 's current release date. During the same interview with CNBC, the CEO said his "level of conviction" is high, reassuring fans that the chance of a second delay is unlikely.

item.title: How to Offer the Kiln a Worthy Sacrifice in PEAK (24 Karat Badge)
item.description:
The journey to PEAK 's highest mountain for a rescue is one of hardship and friendship, but it's also not without its ability to flex on other players. One of the hardest badges to obtain has become the 24 Karat Badge thanks to PEAK 's major update, MESA, which provides not just a new biome, but a secret item inside it that will

The 24 Karat Badge is only available in PEAK version 1.22a and beyond, so make sure your game is up-to-date.

How to Find the Tomb and Get the Golden Bing Bong in PEAK

What Does Golden Bing Bong Do in PEAK?

Once players have arrived in the MESA level, they will need to search for a small hole in the sand . This hole will be available at random, but always in the lower area of the sand region where the twisters can spawn, so don't begin your ascent up the mountain until you have located this hole, and be sure to check deep within caverns. Once you've found it, safely climb down, where you will be met with a different biome: The Tomb.

The Tomb only has a 25% chance to spawn per day, so if you can't find it, it might be best to wait for the daily reset.

Inside the Tomb, players will need to navigate through the parkour puzzle, where a golden Bing Bong will be awaiting them in the center of the room. Don't worry about any traps, as you can safely pick up Golden Bing Bong and leave through a secret exit underneath the stairs that you came down from. Holding Golden Bing Bong has an extremely heavy carry weight , but also provides immunity to all forms of damage , including fall damage. Golden Bing Bong essentially grants invincibility, and players now need to begin their journey out of MESA with Golden Bing Bong.

How to Offer the Kiln a Worthy Sacrifice in PEAK

With the Golden Bing Bong, it's time to head out of MESA to reach the KILN level. Remember, you are immune to all forms of damage with the Golden Bing Bong equipped, so feel free to just run through the lava ocean in CALDERA to make things easier. Once you've arrived in the KILN, simply throw the Golden Bing Bong into the lava below for the badge to pop. This will reward players with the Bing Bong Beanie hat to wear .
